page.title: 06TOURISM IN DEEPCAR/WORTLEY
page.content: {HERITAGE TRAIL.}DEEPCAR:{Vaughton Hill cottages once contained saddler's, smithy, inn and filemaker's. Toll Bar Farm is nearby (Sheffield-Manchester Turnpike).'King & Miller' cottage stabled bear for bear-baiting.{Townend {Hamlet}(17th.C.) consists of Townend House, bought by Samuel Fox in 1857, the old courthouse, a farm and cottages.{Street names}identify local personalities:e.g. John Armitage, John Helliwell, Mr.Cull(former Headmaster). WORTLEY:{Woodhead Road }was the Sheffield-Huddersfield Turnpike; contains Cundy (or Conduit) House, (a former hostelry), milestone, base for tethering post(bull-baiting) and base of stone cross.{Finkle Street hamlet was on old salt road; also Laundry Row workhouse(1765), Keepers' Houses(1862) {NATURE TRAILS.}Excellent walks in Tin Mill, Bitholmes and Wharncliffe Woods.
